column1: An Éored was a division of the Rohirrim consisting of a considerable body of men
column3: who might serve for a specific term or sometimes as a permanent group.  In the early history of Rohan the number could vary
column4: but in the days of King Folcwine a "full Éored" was defined as 120 men (including its captain) and was one hundredth part of the Full Muster of the Riders of the Mark.
column5: note 36  In times of war each First Marshal of the Riddermark had as part of his "household" an Éored ready for battle that he could use at his own discretion.  If the king were riding to war his Éored was called "the Kings Company".
